intro: Rhus striata, commonly known as the smooth sumac, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to North America. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are pinnately arranged and have a smooth, glossy texture. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers in the spring, which are followed by red, fuzzy berries in the fall. Rhus striata thrives in full sun to partial shade and is adaptable to a variety of soil types. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate harsh conditions.
